intro: Eriocaulon pyatan, commonly known as the pyatan sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its reproductive structures are inconspicuous, consisting of tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Eriocaulon pyatan plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
